text.title: 2007 Cricket World Cup: Sri Lanka vs India

text:
2007 Cricket World Cup: Sri Lanka vs India
Friday, March 23, 2007
Sri Lanka beat India by 69 runs in a crucial Group B match at the World Cup at the Queen's Park Oval, Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago.
Victory means that Sri Lanka to progress through to the Super 8 stage with 2 points, however India's loss means that they are out of the tournament if Bangladesh beats World-Cup debutants and currently winless Bermuda, who both India and Sri Lanka beat by over 200 runs. Ducks from Mahendra Singh Dhoni and Sachin Tendulkar, two of India's most touted batsmen prior to the World Cup, sealed the loss although Rahul Dravid and Virender Sehwag built a strong partnership during the middle overs.
Toss: India won, and elected to field first. Sri Lanka innings Player Status Runs Balls 4s 6s Strike rate Upul Tharanga lbw b Tendulkar 64 90 6 0 71.11 Sanath Jayasuriya c Agarkar b Khan 6 23 0 0 26.08 Mahela Jayawardene c Dhoni b Agarkar 7 20 1 0 35.00 Kumar Sangakkara c Patel b Ganguly 15 35 2 0 42.85 Chamara Silva c Dhoni b Khan 59 68 5 0 86.76 Tillakaratne Dilshan c Dhoni b Patel 38 41 3 0 92.68 Russel Arnold not out 19 13 3 0 146.15 Chaminda Vaas not out 19 12 2 1 158.33 Extras (lb 2; w 14; nb 11) 27 Total (6 Wickets; 50 overs) 254 22 1
Fall of wickets: 1-33 (Jayasuriya, 6.6 ov), 2-53 (Jayawardene, 12.4 ov), 3-92 (Sangakkara, 23.3 ov), 4-133 (Tharanga, 32.2 ov), 5-216 (Dilshan, 45.4 ov), 6-216 (Silva, 46.1 ov) India bowling Bowler Overs Maidens Runs Wickets Econ Zaheer Khan 10 0 49 2 4.90 Ajit Agarkar 8 1 33 1 4.12 Munaf Patel 10 1 46 1 4.60 Harbhajan Singh 10 0 53 0 5.30 Sourav Ganguly 4 0 22 1 5.50 Sachin Tendulkar 8 0 40 1 5.00 India innings (Target: 255 runs from 50 overs) Player Status Runs Balls 4s 6s Strike rate Robin Uthappa c & b Vaas 18 27 3 0 66.66 Sourav Ganguly c Muralitharan b Vaas 7 23 0 0 30.43 Virender Sehwag c Jayawardene b Muralitharan 48 46 5 1 104.34 Sachin Tendulkar b Fernando 0 3 0 0 0.00 Rahul Dravid c Muralitharan b Jayasuriya 60 82 6 0 73.17 Yuvraj Singh run out (Arnold/Jayasuriya) 6 12 0 0 50.00 Mahendra Singh Dhoni lbw b Muralitharan 0 1 0 0 0.00 Ajit Agarkar c Arnold b Malinga 10 25 0 0 40.00 Harbhajan Singh not out 17 20 1 1 85.00 Zaheer Khan c Malinga b Muralitharan 1 5 0 0 20.00 Munaf Patel c Vaas b Dilshan 10 17 1 0 58.82 Extras (lb 1; w 7) 8 Total (all out; 43.3 overs) 185 16 2
Fall of wickets: 1-25 (Uthappa, 6.5 ov), 2-43 (Ganguly, 10.5 ov), 3-44 (Tendulkar, 11.3 ov), 4-98 (Sehwag, 22.5 ov), 5-112 (Yuvraj Singh, 27.4 ov), 6-112 (Dhoni, 28.1 ov), 7-136 (Agarkar, 34.4 ov), 8-159 (Dravid, 37.3 ov), 9-161 (Khan, 38.6 ov), 10-185 (Patel, 43.3 ov) Sri Lanka bowling Bowler Overs Maidens Runs Wickets Econ Chaminda Vaas 8 1 39 2 4.87 Lasith Malinga 8 0 39 1 4.87 Dilhara Fernando 6.2 0 32 1 5.05 Muttiah Muralitharan 10 0 41 3 4.10 Sanath Jayasuriya 9 0 31 1 3.44 Tillakaratne Dilshan 2.1 1 2 1 0.92
Sri Lanka: W U Tharanga, S T Jayasuriya, K C Sangakkara (wkt), D P M D Jayawardene (capt), L P C Silva, T M Dilshan, M Muralitharan, W P U J C Vaas, R P Arnold, S L Malinga, C R D Fernando India: R Dravid (capt), S R Tendulkar, S C Ganguly, A R Uthappa, V Sehwag, Yuvraj Singh, M S Dhoni (wkt), A B Agarkar, Z Khan, M M Patel, Harbhajan Singh
Player of the match: M Muralitharan (Sri Lanka)
Umpires: Aleem Dar (Pakistan) and D J Harper (Australia) TV umpire: S J Davis (Australia) Match referee: J J Crowe (New Zealand) Reserve umpire: I L Howell (South Africa)
